item.title: COVID-19 is spreading like wildfire in our jails and prisons but...
item.content:encoded:
ACLU of Colorado

COVID-19 is spreading like wildfire in our jails and prisons but Gov. Polis is ignoring the risks and disregarding guidance from CDPHE and the American Medical Association, which recommends vaccine priority to people living in communal settings — especially jails and prisons. The Governor's failure to safely reduce jail and prison populations in Colorado and this cruel change to the distribution plan puts all of us at risk.

Vaccinations for the first group of Coloradans will begin within weeks.

cpr.org

Who Will Get The First Doses Of Colorado Coronavirus Vaccines?

Vaccinations for the first group of Coloradans will begin within weeks.Vaccinations for the first group of Coloradans will begin within weeks.
item.author: ACLU of Colorado

item.title: “Aurora can’t run as though paying out these settlements is...
item.content:encoded:
ACLU of Colorado

“Aurora can’t run as though paying out these settlements is just the cost of doing business – the cost of running a city. These settlements need to be propelling Aurora to change the police department,” said Mark Silverstein, Legal Director of ACLU of Colorado.

The City of Aurora has paid out more than a quarter of a million dollars to settle a police brutality lawsuit filed in 2018.

kdvr.com

City of Aurora settles federal police brutality case for $285K

The City of Aurora has paid out more than a quarter of a million dollars to settle a police brutality lawsuit filed in 2018.The City of Aurora has paid out more than a quarter of a million dollars to settle a police brutality lawsuit filed in 2018.
item.author: ACLU of Colorado

item.title: Racialized policing in Aurora is an epidemic, and real people...
item.content:encoded:
ACLU of Colorado

Racialized policing in Aurora is an epidemic, and real people and lives are forever altered as a result of excessive use of force by police. Alberto Torres is one of many survivors of police brutality whose story must be told and learned from as we work toward safer policing and accountability.

The ACLU of Colorado announced Thursday it has reached a $285,000 settlement with the city of Aurora in a lawsuit over officers’ investigation of a noise complaint that ended with

denvergazette.com

ACLU settles excessive force lawsuit with Aurora

The ACLU of Colorado announced Thursday it has reached a $285,000 settlement with the city of Aurora in a lawsuit over officers’ investigation of a noise complaint that ended withThe ACLU of Colorado announced Thursday it has reached a $285,000 settlement with the city of Aurora in a lawsuit over officers’ investigation of a noise complaint that ended with
item.author: ACLU of Colorado

item.title: We need a different vision of community safety, one that does...
item.content:encoded:
ACLU of Colorado

We need a different vision of community safety, one that does not include over-policing our Black and Brown neighbors with excessive force, humiliation or death. Demand Aurora police to redirect resources to positive, community-driven solutions that promote the dignity and safety that all Aurora residents deserve. https://action.aclu.org/send-message/co-divest-invest
item.author: ACLU of Colorado

item.title: Imaginate, si en lugar de enviar a 13 oficiales a la casa del...
item.content:encoded:
ACLU of Colorado

Imaginate, si en lugar de enviar a 13 oficiales a la casa del Sr. Torres para una queja de ruido, la ciudad de Aurora envió un equipo de respuesta liderado por civiles para verificar su bienestar y pedir que él y sus amigos bajen el sonido, resultando en una solución sin violencia a un problema menor?
Manda un mensaje a el consejo municipal de Aurora: https://action.aclu.org/send-message/co-divest-invest
item.author: ACLU of Colorado

item.title: Imagine, if instead of 13 officers being dispatched to Mr....
item.content:encoded:
ACLU of Colorado

Imagine, if instead of 13 officers being dispatched to Mr. Torres’s home for a noise complaint, the City of Aurora sent a civilian-led response team to check on his welfare and asked that he and his friends lower their sound, resulting in a non-violent solution to a minor issue? Send a message to Aurora City Council: https://action.aclu.org/send-message/co-divest-invest
item.author: ACLU of Colorado

item.title: Four years ago, Alberto Torres was brutalized by Aurora police,...
item.content:encoded:
ACLU of Colorado

Four years ago, Alberto Torres was brutalized by Aurora police, and later blamed for their actions in an attempt by the officers to cover up their unconstitutional behavior. This semblance of justice must inspire further accountability from Aurora police.

“To this day, Mr. Torres suffers physically and emotionally from that incident, and radicalized police violence in Aurora has continued unabated.”

sentinelcolorado.com

Aurora settles 2018 excessive force lawsuit for $285,000 — VIDEO - Sentinel Colorado

“To this day, Mr. Torres suffers physically and emotionally from that incident, and radicalized police violence in Aurora has continued unabated.”“To this day, Mr. Torres suffers physically and emotionally from that incident, and radicalized police violence in Aurora has continued unabated.”
item.author: ACLU of Colorado

item.title: Since 2003, at least 28 persons of color filed legal action...
item.content:encoded:
ACLU of Colorado

Since 2003, at least 28 persons of color filed legal action against the Aurora Police Department after suffering from officers' horrifying abuse, including the murder of Elijah McClain. Despite increasing litigation, systemic racial disparities in Aurora police enforcement persist. You can find an interactive map of racialized policing in Aurora here: https://viewer.mapme.com/ac0a79ff-9b8d-49cd-8c98-16e38369d5…
item.author: ACLU of Colorado

item.title: ACLU de Colorado anunció hoy un acuerdo de $285,000 en nombre...
item.content:encoded:
ACLU of Colorado

ACLU de Colorado anunció hoy un acuerdo de $285,000 en nombre de Jamie Alberto Torres Soto, un hombre Latino al que se le ordenó ilegalmente salir de su casa y fue golpeado injustificadamente por agentes de la policía de Aurora que fueron llamados para investigar una denuncia por ruido. La demanda detalló no solo un ataque cruel contra el Sr. Torres, sino un patrón generalizado de vigilancia policial con prejuicios raciales en Aurora con poca responsabilidad.
Leer más aquí: https://aclu-co.org/aclu-settles-case-with-aurora-after-po…/
item.author: ACLU of Colorado

item.title: On November 21, 2016, 13 Aurora police officers responded to a...
item.content:encoded:
ACLU of Colorado

On November 21, 2016, 13 Aurora police officers responded to a simple noise complaint at Alberto Torres's home. As happens all too often, Aurora police officers escalated this minor issue into a brutal affair. They beat Mr. Torres solely because he delayed exiting his garage to ask his wife to interpret for him. With that beating, the lives of Mr. Torres and every member of his family were changed and he has yet to recover.

It doesn't have to be this way.

On November 21, 2016, 13 Aurora police officers responded to a simple noise complaint at Alberto Torres's home. As happens all too often, Aurora police offic...

youtube.com

It Doesn't Have to be This Way, Racialized Policing in Aurora

On November 21, 2016, 13 Aurora police officers responded to a simple noise complaint at Alberto Torres's home. As happens all too often, Aurora police offic...On November 21, 2016, 13 Aurora police officers responded to a simple noise complaint at Alberto Torres's home. As happens all too often, Aurora police offic...
item.author: ACLU of Colorado

item.title: ACLU of Colorado announced today a $285,000 settlement on behalf...
item.content:encoded:
ACLU of Colorado

ACLU of Colorado announced today a $285,000 settlement on behalf of Jamie Alberto Torres Soto, a Latino man who was illegally ordered out of his home and unjustifiably beaten by Aurora Police officers who were called to investigate a noise complaint. The lawsuit detailed not only a vicious attack on Mr. Torres but a widespread pattern of racially biased policing in Aurora with little accountability. Read more here: https://aclu-co.org/aclu-settles-case-with-aurora-after-po…/
item.author: ACLU of Colorado

As we head toward the end of Colorado Gives Day, 620 donors have helped us ensure that equality and justice are a lived reality for all people in the U.S. by giving to the ACLU of Colorado. It isn't too late to join them! Donate at coloradogives.org/aclu-co

ACLU of Colorado

We’re halfway through #COGivesDay. 467 donors have already joined us in centering hope in our fight for civil rights and liberties for all people. Join these donors this #COGivesDay by pledging your support at coloradogives.org/aclu-co.

coloradogives.org

www.coloradogives.org
item.author: ACLU of Colorado

item.title: Today is Colorado Gives Day, the annual statewide celebration of...
item.content:encoded:
ACLU of Colorado

Today is Colorado Gives Day, the annual statewide celebration of online giving. Help us ensure that equality and justice are a lived reality for all people in the U.S. by giving to the ACLU of Colorado.

Hope is a discipline. It's a commitment that together, we can create a more perfect union. We won't rest until we fulfill the promise of equal rights for ALL people in the United States.

Your Colorado Gives Day donation supports the ACLU's strengths that make our work effective and collaborative. https://www.coloradogives.org/ACLU-CO
item.author: ACLU of Colorado

item.title: Hope is a discipline. It's a commitment that together, we...
item.content:encoded:
ACLU of Colorado

Hope is a discipline. It's a commitment that together, we can create a more perfect union. We won't rest until we fulfill the promise of equal rights for ALL people in the United States.

Join us in our fight to fulfill this promise and move forward with hope by donating to the ACLU of Colorado. Your Colorado Gives Day donation supports the ACLU's strengths that make our work effective and collaborative.

Donate now at coloradogives.org/aclu-co.

item.title: Hope is a discipline. It’s our promise of reproductive rights...
item.content:encoded:
ACLU of Colorado

Hope is a discipline. It’s our promise of reproductive rights for all. Help make this promise real with your #COGivesDay pre-pledge at https://bit.ly/2pD93Oc. @ColoradoGives

November 3, 2020: Colorado voters pass Paid Family Medical Leave, National Popular Vote, and reject Proposition 115, safeguarding the right to abortion later in pregnancy.

See the results and other info about the 2020 US Election. See Election Results
item.author: ACLU of Colorado

item.title: “We’ve heard a lot of complaints, frankly from rural...
item.content:encoded:
ACLU of Colorado

“We’ve heard a lot of complaints, frankly from rural jailers, that their jails are overcrowded or that they have 80 percent pre-trial detainees, many of whom have misdemeanors that don’t belong there,” said Rebecca Wallace, a lawyer at the American Civil Liberties Union. “They’re no danger to themselves or to anyone else.”

Advocates are urging state judges to be more liberal about letting pre-trial defendants leave jail without paying a cash bond.

cpr.org

Defendants Outnumber The Convicted In San Luis And Other Crowded Rural Jails

Advocates are urging state judges to be more liberal about letting pre-trial defendants leave jail without paying a cash bond.Advocates are urging state judges to be more liberal about letting pre-trial defendants leave jail without paying a cash bond.
item.author: ACLU of Colorado

item.title: "A state that cages people and then out of an extension of...
item.content:encoded:
ACLU of Colorado

"A state that cages people and then out of an extension of judgment exposes them to disease is guilty of extrajudicial punishment and is itself morally diseased." Governor Jared Polis has a duty to protect ALL Coloradans. Whether George Brauchler agrees or not.

When a person is sentenced to a form of incarceration, exposure to a deadly disease is never part of the punishment.

coloradonewsline.com

Polis let himself be bullied on vaccination for inmates - Colorado Newsline

When a person is sentenced to a form of incarceration, exposure to a deadly disease is never part of the punishment.When a person is sentenced to a form of incarceration, exposure to a deadly disease is never part of the punishment.
